description: The request is for a contract to provide professional telephone interpretation services for Service Canada. The service will be used to support staff in delivering government services to clients who do not speak English or French. The bidder must be capable of interpreting English or French into multiple languages. The contract will be available to support officers in all Service Canada Centres, as well as the 1-800-O-Canada contact centre and specialized call centres. The contract period is estimated to be from the date of contract to May 31, 2026, with the option to extend the term by up to two additional one-year periods. There are security requirements associated with the requirement.
full_summary:
# **Request for Proposal - Telephone Interpretation Services**

## **Contract Reference Number and Tender Details**

Contract Reference Number: cb-7511-42919739
Title: Telephone Interpretation Services
Solicitation Number: 100024021

## **Proposal Submission Requirements**

Amendment Number: 4
Publication Date: August 10, 2023
Tender Closing Date: August 30, 2023 2:00 PM EST

## **Scope of Work**

Service Canada is seeking to establish a contract for Telephone Interpretation Services to support staff delivering government services to clients who do not speak English or French. The successful bidder will provide professional telephone interpretation services in a minimum of 24 languages, including English to French, Mandarin, Punjabi, Cantonese, and others, and French to English, Spanish, Vietnamese, and others.

## **Background and Objectives**

Service Canada delivers government services and information on programs such as Employment Insurance (EI), Canada Pension Plan (CPP), and Old Age Security (OAS). The agency aims to improve opportunities for all Canadians, including allophones who are at a disadvantage due to language barriers. The Telephone Interpretation Services contract will support Service Canada staff in providing services to clients in their language of choice.

## **Security Requirements**

The contract will require security clearance and compliance with relevant laws and regulations. For more information, please refer to Part 6 - Security, Financial and other requirements and Part 7 - Resulting Contract Clauses.

## **Proposal Evaluation**

The evaluation of proposals will be based on the Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price. The successful bidder will be selected based on their ability to meet the requirements and provide the best overall value.

## **Contract Period and Options**

The contract period is estimated to be from the date of contract to May 31, 2026. The contract includes an option to extend the term by up to two additional one-year periods.

## **Contact Information**

For any questions or concerns, please contact Jie (Jessica) Bai at:

Email: nc-solicitations-gd@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca
Phone: 819-999-9999

## **Attachments**

Attachments are available on the Canada.ca/tendances website.

---

* Standardized the formatting and punctuation.

* Condensed the text to focus on the essential information.
